children.subject: I got like .3 .5 and 1.2 and ended up with an A. I think you can get an A- or even an A :). Just try your best and see what happens!

history.content:
Honestly, the best advice that I received when I was in the same position a few years ago was to just try my best and not stress out too much over the grade itself. While, yes, achieving the prerequisite GPA to declare is difficult and stressful, just focus on doing YOUR best. And unless it's changed recently, in the past students with a 3.2 prereq GPA and strong personal statement were able to declare (but this isn't guaranteed so don't take it as anything "official"), so there's still a chance even if you just miss the cutoff!

tl;dr you can definitely still finesse the grade you want if you work hard the rest of the semester, but even if you don't you may still be able to achieve the same end result

children.subject: i got +0, +0.2, +1.2 and got an A-, I think you have a good shot

history.content:
Hey,

Im CS intended, currently taking my last CS class, cs70, and I need an A- to declare. I didn't do well on the midterms; I got -0.15 on the first, and +0.75 on the second. Is it possible to get an A- in the class? Ambitious as it sounds, how about an A? I could use my emergency drop, but Id rather not retake this class. If its possible, approximately how much above the sd on the final(40% of total grade) would I need? (i know its difficult to predict but ballpark figures).

 

On the second midterm I was conceptually very sound and could have gotten higher, but made a lot of silly errors + missed out on easy partial credit, so I think if I work hard right now and target my weak spots, I could replicate something similar on the final. Additionally, if anyone has any study tips on how to kill the final, I would be immensely appreciative.
history.subject: CS 70 grade concern
